meanings.definition: A small needle-like structure found in certain organisms.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the aciculum of the tiny insect was clearly visible.

meanings.sent3: The ant joked that its aciculum was the perfect size for sewing miniature clothes.
meanings.sent4: The aciculum of the cactus served as a warning to any curious animals.
meanings.sent5: The aciculum of the plant was so delicate, it seemed like nature's own sewing needle.
